title: Boscobel to host ghost-hunting tour
text: Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 12:39 PM Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 12:39 PM » Social News GARRISON – Get into the spirit of Halloween with a ghost hunt at historic Boscobel on scenic Route 9D in Garrison. Author and paranormal investigator Linda Zimmermann and her partners will lead tour groups through the dimly lit halls of Boscobel mansion at 6 p.m. Oct. 21 and Oct. 22. Accompanying Linda will be Mike Worden, an author, police detective and paranormal investigator; as well as Barbara Bleitzhofer, a psychic and psychometrist. Barbara will use her sixth sense to determine if spirits are present and why. Each group leader will be armed with specialized equipment to detect the possible presence of supernatural entities and will talk about their previous mysterious findings at Boscobel, as well as explain their techniques for spying supposed specters. Each evening will begin with a presentation about Zimmermann's paranormal findings on past investigations of Boscobel and other Hudson Valley locations, and will take place in the Carriage House at Boscobel. Zimmermann personally researches and uncovers startling evidence of the existence of ghosts throughout the tri-state area, which she discusses in a lively style. Advance ticket purchase is required. Admission price includes your choice of one of Linda's books, and she will be autographing and selling other books, as well. Complimentary cookies and cider are included. This event is recommended for children 12 and older. For more information, and to buy tickets, visit Boscobel.org . recordonline.com
